triples.name: Unmanned aerial vehicle
triples.relevance: UAVs are the primary platform used for conducting data collection operations in IoT environments.

triples.name: Internet of Things
triples.relevance: IoT is the target system and domain for which UAV-assisted data collection methods are applied.

triples.name: Data collection
triples.relevance: Data collection is the core task being performed by UAVs in this survey's scope.

triples.name: Sensor
triples.relevance: Sensors are deployed throughout the IoT environment and their clustering and data collection modes are key technical topics.

triples.name: Cluster analysis
triples.relevance: Clustering of sensors is one of the key technologies reviewed for organizing IoT devices for efficient data collection.

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: Path planning (a form of motion planning) is one of the key technologies for optimizing UAV trajectories during data collection.

triples.name: Resource allocation
triples.relevance: Joint resource allocation is discussed as a key technology for optimizing UAV-assisted IoT data collection.

triples.name: Channel access method
triples.relevance: Multiple access methods are identified as an open problem for efficient access in UAV-assisted data collection systems.

triples.name: Wireless sensor network
triples.relevance: Wireless sensor networks represent the distributed IoT infrastructure from which UAVs collect data.
